TDI is used in small quantities in the reactors to produce polymers.  Transfer is accomplished via a transfer pump that is controlled automatically by a flow meter.  The operator sets the desired quantity in the automatic control unit which then transfers the desired amount to a reactor. TDI is also stored in 55 gallon drums inside the storage area room.


Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

Polycoat Products has a Risk Management Program in place to manage the handling of TDI.  The program includes strict requirements for written operating procedures, personnel training, equipment maintenance, incident investigation, process hazard analysis, management of change and periodic review or audit of program elements.  Written procedures are developed as part of this program that specify the steps for every task undertaken related to the TDI system.  Management of change element addresses proper implementation of system updates to ensure that all changes are reviewed properly by knowledgeable persons, all operating procedures reflect the change, and personnel are trained on the change.   The Risk Management Program also requires a pre-startup safety review to ensure that the system is properly reviewed before it is put back into service after a major change.  In addition to the Risk Management Program, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are strictly followed.


Five Year Accident History

The five-year accident history (July 2011 to July 2016) for the Polycoat Products facility reveals that there were no reportable accidents during this period.

RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN - POLYCOAT PRODUCTS - Santa Fe Springs Facility

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Polycoat Products, a division of American Polymers Corporation, has established a Risk Management Plan according to EPA's regulations (40 CFR Part 68) for the TDI Storage and Transfer System to enhance its already existing safety programs.  Polycoat Products is extremely cautious in the handling of all chemicals and is very diligent about safety for its employees, visitors and its neighbors.  Polycoat Products staff is well trained and utilizes modern equipment to provide safeguards.  The TDI Transfer System, that contains the regulated substance Toluene Di-Isocyanate (TDI), is used for supplying TDI to the polymer production reactors in the process area.  


Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Polycoat Products has an emergency response plan in place to handle potential emergency situations at this facility.  This plan was designed to meet the following objectives:

1.) To save lives.
2.) To minimize and avoid injuries.
3.) To protect the environment.
4.) To minimize property damage.

Key elements of the Emergency Response Plan include specific steps that Polycoat Products management expects of its employees to take to protect health of the employees, visitors and the neighbors.  The Emergency Response Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, key phone numbers and contact points, vicinity and evacuation maps, and instructions for evacuation and for actions to be taken in case of a fire, injury, earthquake and chemical spill.  The Emergency Plan is reviewed and updated periodically to ensure that it remains current.
